CME เตรียมสนับสนุน Cardano, Chainlink, และ Stellar – ผลกระทบที่อาจเกิดขึ้นกับ altcoins?

CME to support Cardano, Chainlink, and Stellar – Potential impact on altcoins? 

15h ago//Benjamin Njiri
altcoins
AI

Summary

TH

Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME) ประกาศว่าจะเปิดตัวสินทรัพย์ Futures สำหรับ Cardano (ADA), Chainlink (LINK) และ Stellar (XLM) ตั้งแต่วันที่ 9 กุมภาพันธ์ ซึ่งจะขยายพอร์ตคริปโตของ CME เป็น 7 สินทรัพย์ร่วมกับ Bitcoin และ Ethereum ทางบริษัทจะเสนอทั้งสัญญาขนาดใหญ่และ micro-sized contracts เพื่อให้นักลงทุนมีความยืดหยุ่นและประสิทธิภาพทางการเงินมากขึ้น อย่างไรก็ตาม นักวิเคราะห์เตือนว่าการพัฒนาในครั้งนี้อาจไม่ได้ทำให้ราคาพุ่งขึ้นทันที เนื่องจากการเปิดตัว Futures ของ Solana และ XRP ในอดีตก็ไม่ได้สร้างปรากฏการณ์เชิงบวกต่อราคาในทันที ปัจจุบัน ตลาดคริปโตอยู่ในภาวะขาลง โดย ADA, LINK และ XLM ต่างร่วงลงประมาณ 8% แม้ว่าราคาจะลดลง แต่ข้อมูล on-chain บ่งชี้ว่ากลุ่ม whales กำลังสะสม ADA ในขณะที่ LINK ยังคงแข็งแกร่งด้วยแรงขายที่ต่ำบนตลาดแลกเปลี่ยน แม้การเข้ามาของ CME จะสะท้อนถึงการยอมรับจากสถาบัน แต่ผลกระทบในทันทีอาจจำกัดหากบรรยากาศตลาดยังคงเสี่ยง (risk-off) เช่นเดิม

EN

The Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME) announced it will launch Futures products for Cardano (ADA), Chainlink (LINK), and Stellar (XLM) starting February 9, expanding its crypto portfolio to seven assets alongside Bitcoin and Ethereum. The exchange will offer both large and micro-sized contracts to provide investors with flexibility and capital efficiency. However, analysts warn that this structural development may not trigger immediate price rallies, citing previous muted market reactions to the launches of Solana and XRP futures despite high institutional interest. Currently, the broader market is experiencing a downturn, with ADA, LINK, and XLM all dropping approximately 8%. Despite the bearish price action, on-chain data suggests that whales are accumulating ADA as prices slip, while LINK maintains structural strength with low selling pressure on exchanges. While the CME launch signals deeper institutional integration, the immediate impact may be limited if the current risk-off environment persists.

Key Points

  • CME to launch Futures for ADA, LINK, and XLM on February 9 with standard and micro contracts.
  • Institutional expansion may not guarantee immediate price gains, similar to previous Solana and XRP launches.
  • On-chain data shows whale accumulation for ADA and low selling pressure for LINK amidst a market downturn.

Article

Journalist Posted: February 6, 2026 Cardano, Chainlink, and Stellar are set to score new institutional milestones. From the 9th of February, the Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME) will support Futures products for these altcoins, opening a new venue for big players to gain exposure. As with past crypto offerings, there will be both large and micro-sized contracts. For ADA, the bigger size contract will contain 100K ADA coins, while the smaller one will have 10K ADA. Source: CME Chainlink’s contracts will contain 5K Chainlink [LINK] and 250 LINK coins for the larger and micro offerings, respectively. Finally, Stellar’s larger contract will have 250K Stellar [XLM] , and the smaller version will have 12,500 XLM. The latest addition will expand CME’s crypto portfolio to seven assets, covering Bitcoin, Ethereum [ETH] , Solana, and Ripple [XRP]. According to Giovanni Vicioso, CME Group global head of crypto products, the latest additions will offer investors more tools to gain exposure in the growing markets. He added, “Market participants will now have greater choice with enhanced flexibility and more capital efficiencies.” For his part, Martin Franchi, CEO of NinjaTrader, billed the move as a ‘watershed moment for the futures industry’ and underscored the growing appetite for the new asset class. “Digital assets are reaching a global inflection point as they become increasingly mainstream and more deeply integrated into investors’ portfolios.” Worth pointing out, however, these are structural developments and hardly viewed as bullish updates. For example, when Solana’s CME Futures debuted on the 17th of March 2025, it did $12 million in notional volume. But the price remained sideways below $130 amid broader weak sentiment. Similarly, the XRP CME Futures launch on the 19th May 2025 saw $19 million in notional volume, but the altcoin’s price dipped afterward. As such, similar muted market reactions may play out for Cardano [ADA] , LINK, or XLM, especially if the current risk-off environment extends to the launch date. What’s next for ADA and LINK? Meanwhile, whales were jumping on ADA as the price slipped lower to $0.2. Whale wallets holding 1 million to 10 million ADA, and those holding 100 million ADA, have been adding positions over the past few weeks. Source: Santiment LINK also showed structural strength, with overall selling pressure, as indicated by Supply on Exchanges, remaining relatively low around 119 million LINK. This was comparable to selling pressure in late 2025, signalling a measured dump. Source: Santiment If the altcoin season momentum flips back to positive, the fundamentals could lift LINK and ADA. That said, ADA was down 8.5% in the past 24 hours while LINK traded at $9 after shedding 8%. XLM also posted 8% loss as the crypto rout deepened. Final Thoughts CME Futures’ expansion to ADA, LINK, and XLM underscored deepening institutional exposure to altcoins. However, the February 9 launch may be met with less market optimism amid a broader risk-off environment.
